intro: Antidesma pahangense, commonly known as the Pahang antidesma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia, and thrives in tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces non-showy, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by small, fleshy fruits. Antidesma pahangense is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
